title: Al-Shabaab fighters kill 10 civilians in Somalia
description: Al-Shabaab, which has been fighting the Somali government since 2007, still control parts of the countryside from where they have carried out numerous retaliatory attacks.

title: In North Korea, speculations swirl as Kim Jong-un showcases daughter at public events
description: Regardless of Ju-ae's fate, a notable change has occurred since Kim Jong-un took power: the role of women in the ruling circle.

title: In Madagascar, tropical Cyclone Freddy makes landfall
description: The powerful storm with winds of 130km per hour has killed at least one person.

title: Huawei retains a presence in France, despite 5G ban
description: The Chinese telecom equipment manufacturer has lost nearly a third of its revenue in two years, but says it wants to continue investing in France.

title: Mali blast kills 3 UN peacekeepers
description: A UN official speaking on condition of anonymity said the peacekeepers were from the mission's Senegalese contingent.

title: One year of war in Ukraine: A turning point, but no economic collapse for Europe
description: Despite the severity of the energy crisis, a recession has been avoided but the European industry's competitiveness is weakened and interest rates have spiked.

title: A Ukrainian family tells of their year in France with their 'heart in Kyiv'
description: It will soon be a year since Lessya, her daughters Eva and Amelia, and her ex-husband, arrived in Dijon, driven out by the Russian invasion of Ukraine. The feeling of being lost has gradually given way to a new daily life, though their hearts remain in Ukraine.

title: Biden in Poland says US and allies 'have Ukraine's back'
description: The United States President delivered a speech in Warsaw on Tuesday following a surprise visit to Kyiv the day before.

title: China releases two documents detailing anti-American strategy
description: While China's top diplomat, Wang Yi, was expected in Russia, Beijing denounced Washington's 'Cold War mentality' in a strikingly violent text, portraying Moscow as a victim.

title: Macron praises early-rising workers in bid to exploit pension reform lull
description: The French president visited a vast food market near Paris in the early hours of Tuesday to discuss working conditions. He is trying to move on to new issues even though a feverish Parliament is still debating his proposed pension reform.

title: Nigeria election: A disillusioned nation struck by economic frailties
description: Once the hope of an entire continent, the economy of Africa's most populous country is plagued by favoritism, bad politics and institutionalized banditry. Its large and disillusioned youth expect little from the February 25 presidential election.

title: French pesticide lobby suspected of using false job loss argument to oppose partial ban
description: Several organizations have reported incidents to the High Authority for the Transparency of Public Life regarding a potential breach of ethical obligations by the manufacturers' union.

title: Engie plans massive dividend payout on record results
description: France's third-largest energy company behind TotalEnergies and EDF posted record profits on Tuesday.

title: Bogdan Klich: 'If we don't help the Ukrainians today, no one will be able to help us tomorrow'
description: The former Polish defense minister argues that Russia's war in Ukraine has cemented Western unity, and he considers it necessary to accelerate the process of Kyiv's accession to the European Union.

title: French publishers reject rewriting Roald Dahl
description: Dahl's French publishers said there were no plans to follow the publishers of the English-language versions, who have made hundreds of changes to these famous British children's stories.

title: Algeria makes multiple arrests after opponent flees to France
description: Amira Bouraoui fled the country via Tunisia earlier this month, and found refuge in France, sparking Algiers' anger.

title: In Poland and the Czech Republic, 1.4 million Ukrainians have found a new life
description: The two central European countries have welcomed Ukrainian refugees, providing them with access to jobs, healthcare, education and housing.

title: The French-speaking volunteers of pro-Russian Telegram propaganda
description: Within a few weeks of the invasion of Ukraine, a network of volunteers began translating Russian propaganda to broadcast online. 'Le Monde' went behind the scenes of this French-speaking arm.

title: 'In China, the focus is on direct confrontation with the United States'
description: 'Le Monde' journalist Frédéric Lemaître outlines how the Chinese president criticizes Western modernization by advocating innovation and social justice, while inequalities in the country remain glaring.

title: 'This winter drought is no longer an exception'
description: On Monday, February 20, France experienced its 30th consecutive day without rain, and according to Matthieu Sorel, a climatologist at Météo-France, the rainfall expected on Tuesday and Wednesday will not compensate for this.

title: Putin suspends Russia's participation in New START nuclear treaty
description: This 2010 treaty caps the number of strategic nuclear warheads that the United States and Russia can deploy.

title: The 'LuxLeaks' whistleblower, Raphaël Halet, can finally become an ordinary citizen again
description: After an eight-year legal battle, the Moselle resident has been officially recognized as a 'whistleblower' by the European Court of Human Rights in the Luxembourg tax evasion scandal.

title: 'Le Monde' photographers tell of their year covering the war in Ukraine
description: Our photographers, who have been on the ground since the start of the invasion, reflect on the photos they were most moved by.

title: Rain-free France experiences record-equalling 31-day dry spell
description: Such a prolonged dry spell in France is particularly unusual in winter.

title: In Israel, the Knesset passes contentious reform of the justice system
description: Despite calls for dialogue, Netanyahu's majority voted in favor of legislation to curb the power of the Supreme Court.

title: Biden tells Kyiv 'Moscow's war of conquest is failing'
description: In the Ukrainian capital, the US president announced the delivery of new weapons, and reaffirmed his administration's support for the country.

title: Turkey earthquake: Antakya, the city of buried history
description: In the city known as Antioch in ancient times, much of the cultural heritage was destroyed by the earthquake.

title: 'A manageable risk': Biden's surprise trip to Kyiv
description: The Russians had been warned in advance of the visit by the US president to the Ukrainian capital, which was planned and executed in the greatest secrecy.

title: Content moderation: How the Gonzalez v. Google case could redefine the responsibility of digital platforms
description: On Tuesday, February 21, the US Supreme Court will hear the case filed by the family of one of the victims of the November 2015 Paris attacks.

title: The hidden life of Patrick Hansen, the man who rolled back financial transparency in Europe
description: Beyond his official CV, the Luxembourg businessman owns dozens of companies located in opaque tax havens.

title: French citizens' convention supports 'active aid in dying' under conditions
description: The convention, created by request of President Emmanual Macron consists of 180 randomly-drawn citizens. Of the 167 who voted, 84% said that the current law was ill-suited to the 'different situations encountered.'

title: The filmmaker Michel Deville has died
description: A master of the game of love and chance, he explored all genres, from comedy to detective stories, including closed-door and social dramas, while experimenting with daring narrative modes. He passed away on February 16, at the age of 91.

title: 'The Turkish government has avoided taking responsibility for the destruction and losses'
description: Sociologist Mashuq Kurt wonders whether President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's party, the AKP, can survive the political catastrophe it has created in the wake of a natural disaster.

title: 'The situation in Mali illustrates the limits of the global economic model of international humanitarian aid'
description: With the Malian decision to exclude French NGOs, Pierre Micheletti, a member of the French National Consultative Commission on Human Rights, explains why aid funding needs to be reformed.

title: Video: How Ukraine's army withstood Russia throughout one year of war
description: 'Le Monde' looks back on the military tactics and weapons used over a year of war that saw Vladimir Putin's forces quickly advance, only to be pushed back by Ukraine's fierce resistance.

title: In Ukraine, some soldiers freeze their sperm before heading to war
description: In a country that once was the world capital of surrogacy and in vitro fertilization, assisted reproduction clinics allow men to become fathers after their death. Another way to resist.
